 150 -    def default_setup(self): 

 151          """Default values for all properties""" 
 152   
 153          # Properties related to the particle propagator 
 154          # For an electron, would have the following values 
 155          # pdg_code = 11 
 156          # name = 'e-' 
 157          # antiname = 'e+' 
 158          # spin = '1'   defined as 2 x spin + 1   
 159          # color = '1'  1= singlet, 3 = triplet, 8=octet 
 160          # mass = 'zero' 
 161          # width = 'zero' 
 162          # is_part = 'true'    Particle not antiparticle 
 163          # self_antipart='false'   gluon, photo, h, or majorana would be true 
 164          self['particle'] = base_objects.Particle() 
 165          self['antiparticle'] = base_objects.Particle() 
 166          self['is_part'] = True 
 167          # Properties related to the interaction generating the propagator 
 168          # For an e- produced from an e+e-A vertex would have the following 
 169          # proporties: 
 170          # interaction_id = the id of the interaction in the model 
 171          # pdg_codes = the pdg_codes property of the interaction, [11, -11, 22] 
 172          # inter_color = the 'color' property of the interaction: [] 
 173          # lorentz = the 'lorentz' property of the interaction: ('') 
 174          # couplings = the coupling names from the interaction: {(0,0):'MGVX12'} 
 175          self['interaction_id'] = 0 
 176          self['pdg_codes'] = [] 
 177          self['orders'] = {} 
 178          self['inter_color'] = None 
 179          self['lorentz'] = [] 
 180          self['coupling'] = ['none'] 
 181          # The color index used in this wavefunction 
 182          self['color_key'] = 0 
 183          # Properties relating to the leg/vertex 
 184          # state = initial/final (for external bosons), 
 185          #         intermediate (for intermediate bosons), 
 186          #         incoming/outgoing (for fermions) 
 187          # leg_state = initial/final for initial/final legs 
 188          #             intermediate for non-external wavefunctions 
 189          # number_external = the 'number' property of the corresponding Leg, 
 190          #                   corresponds to the number of the first external 
 191          #                   particle contributing to this leg 
 192          # fermionflow = 1    fermions have +-1 for flow (bosons always +1), 
 193          #                    -1 is used only if there is a fermion flow clash 
 194          #                    due to a Majorana particle  
 195          self['state'] = 'initial' 
 196          self['leg_state'] = True 
 197          self['mothers'] = HelasWavefunctionList() 
 198          self['number_external'] = 0 
 199          self['number'] = 0 
 200          self['fermionflow'] = 1 
 201          # The decay flag is used in processes with defined decay chains, 
 202          # to indicate that this wavefunction has a decay defined 
 203          self['decay'] = False 
 204          # The onshell flag is used in processes with defined decay 
 205          # chains, to indicate that this wavefunction is decayed and 
 206          # should be onshell (True), as well as for forbidden s-channels (False). 
 207          # Default is None 
 208          self['onshell'] = None

 535 -    def set_state_and_particle(self, model): 

 536          """Set incoming/outgoing state according to mother states and 
 537          Lorentz structure of the interaction, and set PDG code 
 538          according to the particles in the interaction""" 
 539   
 540          assert isinstance(model, base_objects.Model), \ 
 541                    "%s is not a valid model for call to set_state_and_particle" \ 
 542                    % repr(model) 
 543   
 544          # leg_state is final, unless there is exactly one initial  
 545          # state particle involved in the combination -> t-channel 
 546          if len(filter(lambda mother: mother.get('leg_state') == False, 
 547                        self.get('mothers'))) == 1: 
 548              leg_state = False 
 549          else: 
 550              leg_state = True 
 551          self.set('leg_state', leg_state) 
 552   
 553          # Start by setting the state of the wavefunction 
 554          if self.is_boson(): 
 555              # For boson, set state to intermediate 
 556              self.set('state', 'intermediate') 
 557          else: 
 558              # For fermion, set state to same as other fermion (in the 
 559              # right way)

 561

 563                  self.set('state', mother.get_with_flow('state'))

 567                  self.set('fermionflow', mother.get('fermionflow')) 
 568                  # Check that the state is compatible with particle/antiparticle 
 569                  if self.get('is_part') and self.get('state') == 'incoming' or \ 
 570                     not self.get('is_part') and self.get('state') == 'outgoing':

 572                                        'outgoing':'incoming'}[self.get('state')])

 576 -    def check_and_fix_fermion_flow(self, 
 577                                     wavefunctions, 
 578                                     diagram_wavefunctions, 
 579                                     external_wavefunctions, 
 580                                     wf_number): 

 581          """Check for clashing fermion flow (N(incoming) != 
 582          N(outgoing)) in mothers. This can happen when there is a 
 583          Majorana particle in the diagram, which can flip the fermion 
 584          flow. This is detected either by a wavefunctions or an 
 585          amplitude, with 2 fermion mothers with same state. 
 586   
 587          In this case, we need to follow the fermion lines of the 
 588          mother wavefunctions until we find the outermost Majorana 
 589          fermion. For all fermions along the line up to (but not 
 590          including) the Majorana fermion, we need to flip incoming <-> 
 591          outgoing and particle id. For all fermions after the Majorana 
 592          fermion, we need to flip the fermionflow property (1 <-> -1). 
 593   
 594          The reason for this is that in the Helas calls, we need to 
 595          keep track of where the actual fermion flow clash happens 
 596          (i.e., at the outermost Majorana), as well as having the 
 597          correct fermion flow for all particles along the fermion line. 
 598   
 599          This is done by the mothers using

1700 -    def sign_flips_to_order(fermions):

3492                        decay2.get('processes')[0].get('legs'))) == 1, \

3494                    "both processes to be unique"

4127                      col_matrix = color_amp.ColorMatrix(col_basis) 
4128                      list_color_matrices.append(col_matrix) 
4129                      col_index = -1 
4130                      logger.info(\ 
4131                        "Processing color information for %s" % \

4133                                       replace('Process', 'process')) 
4134                  else: # Found identical color 
4135                      logger.info(\ 
4136                        "Reusing existing color information for %s" % \

4138                                           replace('Process', 'process')) 
4139                  if gen_color: 
4140                      matrix_element.set('color_basis', 
4141                                         list_color_basis[col_index]) 
4142                      matrix_element.set('color_matrix', 
4143                                         list_color_matrices[col_index]) 
4144

4146              raise MadGraph5Error, \ 
4147                    "No matrix elements generated, check overall coupling orders" 
4148   
4149          return matrix_elements
